title: Increases criminal penalties for assault by gangs
summary: Establishes the offenses of gang assault; imposes additional criminal penalties for assaults committed by gangs as opposed to assaults committed by individuals.

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to assaults by gangs

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  penal  law  is  amended by adding three new sections
    2  120.65, 120.66 and 120.67 to read as follows:
    3  S 120.65 GANG ASSAULT IN THE THIRD DEGREE.
    4    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF GANG ASSAULT IN THE  THIRD  DEGREE,  WHEN  WHILE
    5  AIDED  BY  ONE  OR  MORE  OTHER PERSONS, HE COMMITS ASSAULT IN THE THIRD
    6  DEGREE.
    7    GANG ASSAULT IN THE THIRD DEGREE IS A CLASS D FELONY.
    8  S 120.66 GANG ASSAULT IN THE SECOND DEGREE.
    9    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF GANG ASSAULT IN THE SECOND  DEGREE,  WHEN  WHILE
   10  AIDED  BY  ONE  OR  MORE OTHER PERSONS, HE COMMITS ASSAULT IN THE SECOND
   11  DEGREE.
   12    GANG ASSAULT IN THE SECOND DEGREE IS A CLASS C FELONY.
   13  S 120.67 GANG ASSAULT IN THE FIRST DEGREE.
   14    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF GANG ASSAULT IN THE  FIRST  DEGREE,  WHEN  WHILE
   15  AIDED  BY  ONE  OR  MORE  OTHER PERSONS, HE COMMITS ASSAULT IN THE FIRST
   16  DEGREE.
   17    GANG ASSAULT IN THE FIRST DEGREE IS A CLASS B FELONY.
   18    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   19  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2126

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the penal law, in relation to assaults by gangs

SUMMARY
The penal law is amended by adding three new sections 120.40, 120.45
and 120.50 to impose criminal penalties that make a distinction
between assaults committed by an individual acting on his own and
those committed by a group.

New York State law needs to be updated to keep pace with the ravaging
criminal element and fear that gangs are distilling into our
neighborhoods. Gangs create a threatening, intimidating and dangerous
atmosphere that increases the possibility of criminal behavior among
those individuals that comprise the members of the gang and serve to
paralyze with trepidation both the victims and their neighbors. Since
it increases the likelihood of crime and often is the result of
greater serious physical and mental injury, state law must apply a
separate and harsher legal penalty.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect on
November first next
succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law.
